intro: [WRONG START] Polycarpaea palakkendensis, commonly known as the Palakkad polycarpaea, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking violet-blue flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth texture, while its stems are erect and branched. Polycarpaea palakkadensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
